title: Separate sharding related code from scaling-core module part 3 and refactor job configuration structure

Fixes #13875 part 8.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- Remove SnowflakeKeyGenerateAlgorithm dependency from JobConfiguration, which is in `sharding-core`
- Add getActualDataSourceConfig for ShardingSphereJDBCDataSourceConfiguration, prepare for DataSourcePreparer refactoring
- Add JobDataNodeLine
- Add tablesFirstDataNodes in job handleConfig, prepare for DataSourcePreparer refactoring
- Refactor fields in job handleConfig
- Refactor DataSourcePreparer, separate sharding related code from scaling-core
- Refactor jobShardingDataNodes type in handleConfig

title: Add ModeScheduleContext and integrate with ContextManager
body:
Fixes #13875 part 7.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- Add ModeScheduleContext and integrate with ContextManager. Design for MGR scheduling requirement for now.

Currently, not all mode type is supported:
- Supported : "Cluster" mode type, "ZooKeeper" repository type
- Unsupported : "Standalone" mode type, "Memory" mode type and other  repository type in "Cluster" mode

Sharing registry center API of ShardingSphere and ElasticJob is considerred, API:
- ShardingSphere : PersistRepository, ClusterPersistRepository, StandalonePersistRepository
- ElasticJob : CoordinatorRegistryCenter
They are so different to use adapter design pattern.

There're still some `TODO` comment in `ModeScheduleContext`, it'll be refactored later. Seems it need to refactor module dependency (`mode` has no api module to depend on).

title: Decoupling JDBCBackendConnection from ConnectionSession
body:
Related to #13957 

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- Make abstract class `ConnectionSession` to final and use it in proxy as possible
- Rename `JDBCConnectionSession` to `JDBCBackendConnection` and extract `BackendConnection` from it
- `JDBCBackendConnection` implements `BackendConnection`
- Decoupling `JDBCBackendConnection` from `CommandExecutorTask` and push down logic of closing resources to `JDBCBackendConnection`

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- Refactor `ScalingConstant` into `CDCDataChangeType` and `MigrationConstant`. Separate SCALING_ROOT path of registry center (`/scaling`).
- Remove scaling exception dependency of AbstractInventoryDumper. Separate from scaling.
- Remove ScalingContext dependency of Channel impl. Separate from scaling.
- Separate `TaskConfiguration` from `DataSourceManager`. Separate from scaling.
- Move position, config, record, datasource, channel and dumper classes to `cdc-core` module
- Move related unit test to `cdc-core` module

title: Separate sharding related code from scaling-core module part 1
body:
Fixes #13875 part 2.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- Rename `ScalingDataSourceConfiguration` to `TypedDataSourceConfiguration`, refactor it as SPI. Since `ShardingSphereDataSource` is in `shardingsphere-jdbc-core` module, it could not be dependency of L1 layer or `shardingsphere-sharding-core` module
- Refactor `JdbcUtil` into `JdbcUri` and `TypedDataSourceConfiguration`
- Unmarshal yaml with skipMissingProperties when structure changed. Since `schemaName` is removed in `TypedDataSourceConfigurationWrap` which is part of job configuration, it cause yaml unmarshaling failure.
- Separate ScalingWorker; Separate AbstractDataSourcePreparer; Separate ShardingRuleConfigurationSwapper and rename;

title: Ignore DataSource property name which value is null when building DataSourceConfiguration from DataSource
body:
Fixes #13632.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- Ignore DataSource property name which value is null. Make sure keys like `driverClassName: null` won't be persisted into `/metadata/sharding_db/dataSources`, it will cause NullPointerException from `HikariConfig.setDriverClassName` when initializing HikariDataSource.
